METRIC_NBM_DENTAL: Lost all of their natural teeth because of tooth decay or gum disease.
UNIT_NBM_DENTAL: % of adults aged ≥65. Lower values are better.
UNIT_NBM_PREVENTATIVE: % of adults. Higher values are better.
UNIT_NBM_SUPERMARKETACCE: % of pop. Higher values are better.
UNIT_PS_ACCIDENTS: per 10,000 pop. Lower values are better.
UNIT_PS_PROPERTY: per 10,000 pop. Lower values are better.
UNIT_PS_VIOLENT: per 10,000 pop. Lower values are better.
UNIT_S_EVICTIONS: per 100 renter homes. Lower values are better.
UNIT_S_HBURDENOWNER: % of housing units. Lower values are better.
UNIT_S_HBURDENRENTER: % of housing units. Lower values are better.
UNIT_S_HOMELESS: per 100,000 pop. Lower values are better.
UNIT_S_OVERCROWDED: % of households. Lower values are better.
METRIC_WS_DRINKINGWATER: Safe Drinking Water Act health-based violations
METRIC_WS_HAZARDOUSWASTE: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act hazardous waste violations
UNIT_ABK_G3READING: % of 3rd graders. Higher values are better.
UNIT_ABK_G8MATH: % of 8th graders. Higher values are better.
METRIC_ABK_HSINCOMPLETE: Population without high school education or equivalent
UNIT_ABK_HSINCOMPLETE: % of pop. ages 18-24. Lower values are better.
METRIC_ABK_LESSTHAN9TH: Population with less than 9th grade education
UNIT_ABK_LESSTHAN9TH: % of pop. Lower values are better.
UNIT_ABK_PRESCHOOLENROLL: % of 3 & 4 year olds. Higher values are better.
UNIT_AIC_BROADBAND: % of pop. Higher values are better.
UNIT_AIC_BROADBANDSPEED: download speed in Mbps. Higher values are better.
UNIT_AIC_CELLDATA: % of pop. Higher values are better.
UNIT_AIC_NOINTERNET: % of pop. Lower values are better.
METRIC_EQ_DEFORESTATION: Percentage Forest Cover Decline from 2011 to 2016
METRIC_EQ_FLOODRISK: Percentage of Land Area in High Risk Flood Zone
UNIT_HW_CANCER: % of adults. Lower values are better.
UNIT_HW_CHD: % of adults. Lower values are better.
UNIT_HW_DIABETES: % of adults. Lower values are better.
UNIT_HW_DRUGOD: per 100,000 pop. Lower values are better.
UNIT_HW_MENTALHEALTH: average number of poor mental health days. Lower values are better.
UNIT_HW_MENTALHEALTHFACILITIES: per 100,000 pop. Higher values are better.
UNIT_HW_OBESITY: % of adults. Lower values are better.
UNIT_AAE_ASSOCIATES: % of pop. age 25+. Higher values are better.
UNIT_AAE_BACHELORS: % of pop. age 25+. Higher values are better.
UNIT_AAE_GRADUATE: % of pop. age 25+. Higher values are better.
UNIT_I_GENDERPAYGAP: female/male pay ratio. Higher values are better.
UNIT_I_LINGUISTIC: % of households. Higher values are better.
UNIT_PFC_CLEANCOMMUTE: % of commuters. Higher values are better.
UNIT_PFC_DISCONNECTED: % of 16-19 year olds. Lower values are better.
UNIT_PFC_ECE: % of districts. Higher values are better.
METRIC_PR_BULLYINGHARASSMENT: Harassment or Bullying Incidents in Schools
UNIT_PR_BULLYINGHARASSMENT: per 1,000 enrolled. Lower values are better.
UNIT_PR_FATAL: per 100,000 pop. Lower values are better.
UNIT_PR_HOMEOWNERSHIP: % of households. Higher values are better.
UNIT_PR_INCARCERATION: per 100,000 pop. Lower values are better.
UNIT_PR_TURNOUT: % of voting eligible pop. Higher values are better.
HINT_NBM_DENTAL: Rate of visits to dentist or dental clinic for adults aged 18 and older in the previous year
HINT_NBM_FOODSTAMPS: Estimated percentage of food insecure households, where food security is defined as having access, at all times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members.
HINT_NBM_PREVENTATIVE: Rate of visits to doctor for routine checkup for adults aged 18 and older in the previous year
HINT_NBM_SUPERMARKETACCE: Share of tract population that are beyond 1/2 mile from supermarket
HINT_PS_ACCIDENTS: Number of fatal motor vehicle accidents per 10,000 persons.
HINT_PS_PROPERTY: Property crime includes the offenses of burglary, larceny-theft, motor vehicle theft, and arson
HINT_PS_VIOLENT: Violent crime is composed of four offenses: murder and nonnegligent manslaughter, forcible rape, robbery, and aggravated assault.
HINT_S_EVICTIONS: Number of evictions per 100 renter homes in each census tract
HINT_S_HBURDENOWNER: Fraction of owned housing units with cost greater than 30% of household income
HINT_S_HBURDENRENTER: Fraction of rented housing units with cost greater than 30% of household income
HINT_S_HOMELESS: Unhoused/homeless persons per 100,000 persons as measured by local continuum-of-care (CoC) point-in-time (PIT) counts.
HINT_S_OVERCROWDED: Percentage of households with more than one occupant per room.
HINT_WS_DRINKINGWATER: Three year average of Safe Drinking Water Act health-based violations in public drinking water systems, modeled to census tract level from source location data.
HINT_WS_HAZARDOUSWASTE: Three year average of Resource Conservation and Recovery Act hazardous waste violations at monitored sites, modeled to census tract level from source location data.
HINT_WS_IMPERVIOUS: Percent of surface areas that are impervious to water.
HINT_ABK_G3READING: Percentage of 3rd graders reaching proficiency in language arts on state standardized tests where proficiency levels are modeled to be consistent across states and years.
HINT_ABK_G8MATH: Percentage of 8th graders reaching proficiency in mathematics on state standardized tests where proficiency levels are modeled to be consistent across states and years.
HINT_ABK_HSINCOMPLETE: Percent of population aged 18-24 without high school diploma or equivalent.
HINT_ABK_LESSTHAN9TH: Percentage of population with less than a 9th grade education.
HINT_ABK_PRESCHOOLENROLL: Percentage of three and four year olds enrolled in school
HINT_AIC_BROADBAND: Percentage of population with a broadband subscription.
HINT_AIC_BROADBANDSPEED: Average maximum download speed in megabytes per second advertised by all consumer ISPs.
HINT_AIC_CELLDATA: Percentage of population with a cellular data subscription.
HINT_AIC_NOINTERNET: Percentage of population with out any access to the internet.
HINT_EQ_DEFORESTATION: Percentage decline in total forested area in 2016 compared to base year 2011.
HINT_EQ_FLOODRISK: Percentage of total land area in FEMA-designated high-risk flood zones A, AE, V, or VE which all have at least a 1% annual chance of flooding and a 26% chance of flooding over the life of a 30-year mortgage.
HINT_EQ_NO2: Average annual nitrogen dioxide concentration in parts per billion, modeled to census tract level from air quality monitoring station data.
HINT_EQ_OZONE: Average 8-hour ozone concentration in parts per million, modeled to census tract level from air quality monitoring station data.
HINT_EQ_PM25: Average annual particulate matter (2.5) in micrograms per cubic meter, modeled to census tract level from air quality monitoring station data.
HINT_HW_CANCER: Cancer (excluding skin cancer) prevalence among adults aged 18 and older.
HINT_HW_CHD: Coronary heart disease prevalence among aduts aged 18 and older
HINT_HW_DIABETES: Percentage of adults aged 20 and above with diagnosed diabetes.
HINT_HW_DRUGOD: Deaths attributable to drug and alcohol overdoses per 100,000 persons.
HINT_HW_MENTALHEALTH: The average number of days a location's adult respondents report that their mental health was not good, based on the survey question: “Thinking about your mental health, which includes stress, depression, and problems with emotions, for how many days during the past 30 days was your mental health not good?”.
HINT_HW_MENTALHEALTHFACILITIES: Presence of mental health or substance abuse facilities per 100,000 persons.
HINT_HW_OBESITY: Percentage of adults that report a BMI of 30 or more.
HINT_AAE_ASSOCIATES: Percent of population 25 and older whose highest degree attained is an Associate's degree.
HINT_AAE_BACHELORS: Percent of population 25 and older whose highest degree attained is a Bachelor's degree.
HINT_AAE_GRADUATE: Percent of population 25 and older whose highest degree attained is a Master's, professional school degree, or Doctorate.
HINT_I_DISSIMILARITY: Index of dissimilarity between white and non-white tract residents. Conceptually, dissimilarity measures the percentage of a group’s population that would have to change residence for each block to have the same percentage of that group as the tract overall. The index ranges from 0.0 (complete integration) to 1.0 (complete segregation).
HINT_I_FEMALEREPRESENTATION: Percentage of women in state legislature or city council or equivalent in jurisdiction.
HINT_I_GENDERPAYGAP: Ratio of female to male median earnings in the past 12 months (2017 inflation-adjusted dollars)
HINT_I_ISOLATION: The isolation index measures the extent to which non-white tract residents are exposed only to one another, and is computed as the non-white-weighted average of the non-white proportion in each area.
HINT_I_LINGUISTIC: Households in which no one 14 and over speaks English only or speaks a language other than English at home and speaks English very well.
HINT_PFC_CLEANCOMMUTE: Percentage of commuters taking public transit, biking, walking, or working remotely.
HINT_PFC_DISCONNECTED: Percentage of teens and young adults ages 16-19 who are neither working nor in school.
HINT_PFC_ECE: Percentage of Local Educational Agencies (LEA), or school districts, that provide early childhood services to children birth through age 2.
HINT_PR_BULLYINGHARASSMENT: Number of reported bullying or harassment incidents on the basis of sex, race, or disability status in schools per 1,000 enrolled students.
HINT_PR_FATAL: Number of incidents involving fatal encounters with law enforcment per 100,000 persons.
HINT_PR_HOMEOWNERSHIP: Percentage of households that are owner-occupied.
HINT_PR_INCARCERATION: Rate of incarceration in state prisons and county jails per 100,000 persons.
HINT_PR_TURNOUT: Total number of voters divided by voting eligible population in the 2018 Midterm Elections.
UNIT_NBM_FOODSTAMPS: % of households. Lower values are better.
METRIC_NBM_WOMENCOREHEALTH: Core Set Of Clinical Preventive Services (Women)
UNIT_NBM_WOMENCOREHEALTH: % of women aged ≥65. Higher values are better.
METRIC_NBM_MENCOREHEALTH: Core Set Of Clinical Preventive Services (Men)
UNIT_NBM_MENCOREHEALTH: % of men aged ≥65. Higher values are better.
METRIC_NBM_POORHEALTH: Physical health not good for ≥14 day
UNIT_NBM_POORHEALTH: % of adults aged ≥18. Lower values are better.
METRIC_S_NOKITCHEN: Housing Units lacking complete kitchen facilities
UNIT_S_NOKITCHEN: % of occupied housing units. Lower values are better.
UNIT_WS_DRINKINGWATER: Safe Drinking Water Act health-based violations. Lower values are better.
UNIT_WS_HAZARDOUSWASTE: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act hazardous waste violations. Lower values are better.
METRIC_WS_FLOODRISK: Land Area in High Risk Flood Zone
UNIT_WS_FLOODRISK: Likelihood of flooding (0=no risk). Lower values are better.
METRIC_WS_NOPLUMBING: Housing Units lacking complete plumbing facilities
UNIT_WS_NOPLUMBING: % of occupied housing units. Lower values are better.
METRIC_EQ_EGRIDRENEWABLES: Electricity generated by plants using renewable energy resources
UNIT_EQ_EGRIDRENEWABLES: % of electricity generated. Higher values are better.
METRIC_EQ_WATERSTRESS: Composite score all hydric resources-related risks
UNIT_EQ_WATERSTRESS: Score from 0 to 1. Lower values are better.
METRIC_EQ_AFFECTEDGLOBALWA: People that have personally experienced the effects of global warming
UNIT_EQ_AFFECTEDGLOBALWA: % of pop. Lower values are better.
UNIT_PFC_ALTERCOMMUTE: % of commuters. Higher values are better.
UNIT_PFC_TEENBIRTHRATE: % of women ages 15-19. Lower values are better.
METRIC_PFC_ADULTNOINSURANC: People aged 18–64 years who report having no current health insurance coverage
UNIT_PFC_ADULTNOINSURANC: % of adults ages 18-64. Lower values are better.
UNIT_PR_GENDERGAPPOWER: absolute distance from 1. Lower values are better.
DESC_NBM_DENTAL: Respondents aged ≥65 years who report having lost all of their natural teeth because of tooth decay or gum disease.
DESC_NBM_FOODSTAMPS: Estimated percentage of food insecure households, where food security is defined as having access, at all times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members.
DESC_NBM_WOMENCOREHEALTH: Number of women aged ≥65 years reporting having received all of the following: an influenza vaccination in the past year; a pneumococcal vaccination (PPV) ever; either a fecal occult blood test (FOBT) within the past year, a sigmoidoscopy within the past 5 years and a FOBT within the past 3 years, or a colonoscopy within the previous 10 years; and a mammogram in the past 2 years.
DESC_NBM_MENCOREHEALTH: Number of men aged ≥65 years reporting having received all of the following: an influenza vaccination in the past year; a PPV ever; and either a fecal occult blood test (FOBT) within the past year, a sigmoidoscopy within the past 5 years and a FOBT within the past 3 years, or a colonoscopy within the past 10 years.
DESC_NBM_POORHEALTH: Respondents aged ≥18 years who report 14 or more days during the past 30 days during which their physical health was not good.
DESC_NBM_SUPERMARKETACCE: Share of tract population that are beyond 1/2 mile from supermarket
DESC_PS_ACCIDENTS: Number of fatal motor vehicle accidents per 10,000 persons.
DESC_PS_PROPERTY: Property crime includes the offenses of burglary, larceny-theft, motor vehicle theft, and arson
DESC_PS_VIOLENT: Violent crime is composed of four offenses: murder and nonnegligent manslaughter, forcible rape, robbery, and aggravated assault.
DESC_S_HBURDENOWNER: Fraction of owned housing units with cost greater than 30% of household income
DESC_S_HBURDENRENTER: Fraction of rented housing units with cost greater than 30% of household income
DESC_S_HOMELESS: Unhoused/homeless persons per 100,000 persons as measured by local continuum-of-care (CoC) point-in-time (PIT) counts.
DESC_S_OVERCROWDED: Percentage of households with more than one occupant per room.
DESC_S_NOKITCHEN: Percentage of Occupied Housing Units lacking complete kitchen facilities (sink with a faucet, stove or a range, refrigerator)
DESC_WS_DRINKINGWATER: Three year average of Safe Drinking Water Act health-based violations in public drinking water systems, modeled to census tract level from source location data.
DESC_WS_HAZARDOUSWASTE: Three year average of Resource Conservation and Recovery Act hazardous waste violations at monitored sites, modeled to census tract level from source location data.
DESC_WS_FLOODRISK: Probabilistic flood model, which means it considers uncertainty and outputs a distribution of likelihoods. It first asks the question: “what is the likelihood of a flood occurring within a given year?” Based on a location’s history and geographic information (such as elevation, climate, proximity to water, and adaptation measures), the model creates a range of probabilities, known as “return periods.”
DESC_WS_NOPLUMBING: Percentage of Occupied Housing Units lacking complete plumbing facilities (hot and cold running water, bathtub or shower)
DESC_ABK_G3READING: Percentage of 3rd graders reaching proficiency in language arts on state standardized tests where proficiency levels are modeled to be consistent across states and years.
DESC_ABK_G8MATH: Percentage of 8th graders reaching proficiency in mathematics on state standardized tests where proficiency levels are modeled to be consistent across states and years.
DESC_ABK_HSINCOMPLETE: Percent of population aged 18-24 without high school diploma or equivalent.
DESC_ABK_LESSTHAN9TH: Percentage of population with less than a 9th grade education.
DESC_ABK_PRESCHOOLENROLL: Percentage of three and four year olds enrolled in school
DESC_AIC_BROADBAND: Percentage of population with a broadband subscription.
DESC_AIC_BROADBANDSPEED: Average maximum download speed in megabytes per second advertised by all consumer ISPs.
DESC_AIC_CELLDATA: Percentage of population with a cellular data subscription.
DESC_AIC_NOINTERNET: Percentage of population with out any access to the internet.
DESC_EQ_NO2: Average annual nitrogen dioxide concentration in parts per billion, modeled to census tract level from air quality monitoring station data.
DESC_EQ_OZONE: Average 8-hour ozone concentration in parts per million, modeled to census tract level from air quality monitoring station data.
DESC_EQ_PM25: Average annual particulate matter (2.5) in micrograms per cubic meter, modeled to census tract level from air quality monitoring station data.
DESC_EQ_EGRIDRENEWABLES: State level data developed by summing up the Plant file data on resource mix (renewable vs nonrenewable energy source) based on the state in which the plant is located.
DESC_EQ_WATER_STRESS: Composite score all water-related risks, by aggregating all selected indicators from the Physical Quantity, Quality and Regulatory & Reputational Risk categories
DESC_EQ_AFFECTEDGLOBALWA: Percentage of respondents who have personally experienced the effects of global warming
DESC_HW_CANCER: Cancer (excluding skin cancer) prevalence among adults aged 18 and older.
DESC_HW_CHD: Coronary heart disease prevalence among aduts aged 18 and older
DESC_HW_DIABETES: Percentage of adults aged 20 and above with diagnosed diabetes.
DESC_HW_DRUGOD: Deaths attributable to drug and alcohol overdoses per 100,000 persons.
DESC_HW_MENTALHEALTH: The average number of days a tract’s adult respondents report that their mental health was not good, based on the survey question: “Thinking about your mental health, which includes stress, depression, and problems with emotions, for how many days during the past 30 days was your mental health not good?”.
DESC_HW_OBESITY: Percentage of adults that report a BMI of 30 or more.
DESC_AAE_ASSOCIATES: Percent of population 25 and older whose highest degree attained is an Associate's degree.
DESC_AAE_BACHELORS: Percent of population 25 and older whose highest degree attained is a Bachelor's degree.
DESC_AAE_GRADUATE: Percent of population 25 and older whose highest degree attained is a Master's, professional school degree, or Doctorate.
DESC_I_DISSIMILARITY: Index of dissimilarity between white and non-white tract residents. Conceptually, dissimilarity measures the percentage of a group’s population that would have to change residence for each block to have the same percentage of that group as the tract overall. The index ranges from 0.0 (complete integration) to 1.0 (complete segregation).
DESC_I_GENDERPAYGAP: Ratio of female to male median earnings in the past 12 months (2017 inflation-adjusted dollars)
DESC_I_ISOLATION: The isolation index measures the extent to which non-white tract residents are exposed only to one another, and is computed as the non-white-weighted average of the non-white proportion in each area.
DESC_I_LINGUISTIC: Households in which no one 14 and over speaks English only or speaks a language other than English at home and speaks English very well.
DESC_I_COMMUTETIME: Average commute time to work, workers 16 years and over
DESC_PFC_ALTERCOMMUTE: Percentage of commuters taking public transit, biking, walking, or working remotely.
DESC_PFC_DISCONNECTED: Percentage of teens and young adults ages 16-19 who are neither working nor in school.
DESC_PFC_ADULTNOINSURANC: People aged 18–64 years who report having no current health insurance coverage
DESC_PR_FATAL: Number of incidents involving fatal encounters with law enforcment per 100,000 persons.
DESC_PR_STATECONSTAGAINS: State constitution prohibits government discrimination on basis of sex
DESC_PR_GENDERGAPPOWER: Absolute distance from 1 to the ratio of female to male political representation. (Number closer to 1 = more gender balance, numbers farther from 1 = less balance.)
DESC_PR_HOMEOWNERSHIP: Percentage of households that are owner-occupied.
DESC_PR_TURNOUT: Total number of voters divided by voting eligible population in the 2018 Midterm Elections.
